meanings.definition: To thicken or cause to become more viscous.
meanings.sent1: Stirring the mixture is inspissating it.
meanings.sent2: The sauce is inspissating as it simmers on the stove.
meanings.sent3: The inspissating pudding was too thick to pour.
meanings.sent4: Her words seemed to inspissate the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The inspissating fog made it hard to see beyond a few feet.

meanings.sent1: The inspissating liquid formed a gel-like consistency.
meanings.sent2: The inspissating fog obscured the view of the mountains.
meanings.sent3: The inspissating traffic made the commute even longer.
meanings.sent4: The inspissating plot of the story kept the readers engaged.
meanings.sent5: The inspissating clouds signaled an impending storm.
